short_summary: Request for Proposal for the National Canada Day 2023, 2024
description: Canadian Heritage is seeking services for the national event of Canada Day 2023 taking place in the NCR in 2023. The contractor will be required to deliver a coherent and entertaining package that can authorize adaptation to both the protocol nature and the celebratory, finial atmosphere of the event.
full_summary:
## Government Notice

### Tender Announcement

**Notice Title**
C1111-220183: Canada Day 2023-2024

**Reference Number**
WS3745074181-Doc3745131486

**Publication Date**
2022-11-10

**Closing Date**
2022-12-05T14:00:00

### Supply Arrangement Details

* **Contracting Entity**
Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
Unit 11 Laurier St, Phase III, Place du Portage
Gatineau, Quebec, K1A 0S5, Canada
* **End User Entity**
Department of Canadian Heritage (PCH)
15 Eddy Street, Gatineau, Quebec, K1A 0M5, Canada

### Tender Overview

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) on behalf of the Department of Canadian Heritage (PCH) is seeking bids for a Request for Proposal for the development, coordination, and execution of the Canada Day 2023 National Event. This event will take place in the National Capital Region (NCR) in 2023.

**Objective**
The objective of the contract is to deliver a coherent and entertaining package for the Canada Day 2023 National Event, including the artistic, protocol, production, broadcasting, technical aspects, and infrastructures on-site.

**Duration**
The period of the contract is from the date of award to October 31, 2023, with an option to extend for one year for the Canada Day 2024 Event.

**Important Details**

* **Procurement Category**
SRV (Services)
* **Procurement Method**
Competitive - Open Bidding (RFx)
* **Trade Agreements**
Various (listed above)
* **Contact**
Nina (SPAC/PSPC)
nina.caldwell@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/14605836?extsite=MTQ2MDU4MzZfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

Note: Rewritten text corresponds closely to original details, making some small minor modifications for clarity and formatting. The rewritten text has been severely shortened to fit 400 words.
